title: Manipulative Interaction Pedagogy for Overcoming Quadrilateral Learning Barriers and Developing Mathematical Creativity

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic geometric concepts (types of quadrilaterals, angles, length measurement, etc.)
context.additional_context: Learner role: students/job seekers, domain expertise: intermediate, assessment method: project-based evaluation, technical environment: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device)

learning_goals: Identify and explain ≥3 common misconceptions related to quadrilaterals
Improve spatial reasoning ability by 20% through puzzle-based manipulative activities
Complete ≥1 quadrilateral transformation project aligned with mathematical creativity criteria (originality, flexibility, elaboration)
Create concept maps reflecting peer feedback to visualize learning obstacles
Apply the 7 frameworks (scaffolding, questioning techniques, etc.) from instructional design research to actual classroom settings
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
